request.description: Use this to get a list of assets. The response will only contain assets of one type. The asset hierarchy is warehouses > databases > schemas > tables. If mcon is given, the response will only contain this object. To get all warehouses, omit both mcon and parentMcon. This assumes the parent to be the account. To get all databases/projects under a warehouse, provide the mcon of the warehouse. To get all schemas/datasets under a database, provide the mcon of the database. To get all tables under a schema, provide the mcon of the schema.

graphql.query:
query getEtlJob($mcon: String!) {
  getEtlJob(mcon: $mcon) {
    __typename
    ... on AirflowDag {
      __typename
      id # The ID of the object.
      createdTime
      updatedTime
      # account
      generatesIncidents # Generate incidents for job failures
      uuid # UUID of Run
      # resource # ETL container associated with the pipeline
      mcon
      dagId # DAG ID
      envName # AirFlow environment name
      # runs # Dag associated with the event
      # tasks # Tasks in this dag
      # sourceTables # Tables read from in this dag
      # destTables # Tables modified in this dag
    }
  }
}

    metrics: $metrics
    startTime: $startTime
    endTime: $endTime

    excludeFeedback: $excludeFeedback
    includeNormalized: $includeNormalized
    severities: $severities
    incidentCategories: $incidentCategories
    upstreamLevels: $upstreamLevels
    domainId: $domainId
  ) {
    __typename
    metric # Metric identifier
    # dataPoints # Data points for the metric
    fillMissingDataPointsWith # Value to use for missing data points. This is used to tell the FE which is the value to use when there is no data for a specific date or time.

  }
}

    isTemplateManaged # Is this monitor managed by a configuration template (notifications-as-code)?
    namespace # Namespace of notification, used for notifications-as-code
    type # Type of notification integration (e.g. slack)
    recipients # Destinations to send notifications to
    extra # Any additional information for various notification integrations
    # routingRules
    notificationScheduleType # Indicates whether the notification is of real time or digest types
    notificationEnabled # When enabled notifications for this setting are sent.
    # audience # Notification settings per audience
    # slackMsgDetails
    specificationRule # Deprecated. Use routingRules tableRules.
    recipient # Deprecated. Use recipients instead.
    recipientDisplayName
    recipientsDisplayNames
    # digestSettings
    permalink
    # notificationCountHistory # Number of incidents per day for the past 30 days
    anomalyTypes # anomaliesLimit notifications to specific incident types (default=all). Supported options include: , schema_changesLimit notifications to specific incident types (default=all). Supported options include: , json_schema_changesLimit notifications to specific incident types (default=all). Supported options include: , deleted_tablesLimit notifications to specific incident types (default=all). Supported options include: , metric_anomaliesLimit notifications to specific incident types (default=all). Supported options include: , custom_rule_anomaliesLimit notifications to specific incident types (default=all). Supported options include: , performance_anomaliesLimit notifications to specific incident types (default=all). Supported options include: , dbt_errorsLimit notifications to specific incident types (default=all). Supported options include: , etl_errorsLimit notifications to specific incident types (default=all). Supported options include: , pseudo_integration_testLimit notifications to specific incident types (default=all). Supported options include: , rule_run_execution_error
    incidentSubTypes # Limit notifications to specific incident sub types (default=all).
    matchingIncidents
    customMessage # Message to add on every notification
    integrationId # Integration ID for the recipient
  }
}

graphql.query:
query getTableRcas($mcon: String!, $startTime: DateTime!, $endTime: DateTime) {
  getTableRcas(mcon: $mcon, startTime: $startTime, endTime: $endTime) {
    __typename
    ... on JobRca {
      __typename
      rcaType # RCA type
      rcaUuid # Unique identifier of an RCA
      mcon # The MCON of the table associated with the RCA
    }
    ... on FailedDataRca {
      __typename
      rcaType # RCA type
      rcaUuid # Unique identifier of an RCA
      queryLogGroupHash # Hash of query group the query belongs to
      queryLogId # UUID of specific query
      queryType # The type of query that failed
      querySubtype # The sub-type of the query that failed
      user # The user who ran the query that failed
      startTime # The RCA start time
      mcon # The MCON of the table associated with the RCA
      errorCode # The internal error code type
      errorMsg # The error msg from the warehouse
    }
    ... on FutileDataRca {
      __typename
      rcaType # RCA type
      rcaUuid # Unique identifier of an RCA
      queryLogGroupHash # Hash of query group the query belongs to
      queryLogId # UUID of specific query
      queryType # The type of query that failed
      querySubtype # The sub-type of the query that failed
      user # The user who ran the query that failed
      startTime # The RCA start time
      mcon # The MCON of the table associated with the RCA
    }
    ... on ChangeDataRca {
      __typename
      rcaType # RCA type
      rcaUuid # Unique identifier of an RCA
      queryLogGroupHash # Hash of query group the query belongs to
      queryLogId # UUID of specific query
      queryType # The type of query that failed
      querySubtype # The sub-type of the query that failed
      user # The user who ran the query that failed
      startTime # The RCA start time
      mcon # The MCON of the table associated with the RCA
    }
    ... on UpstreamDataRca {
      __typename
      rcaType # RCA type
      rcaUuid # Unique identifier of an RCA
      queryLogGroupHash # Hash of query group the query belongs to
      queryLogId # UUID of specific query
      queryType # The type of query that failed
      querySubtype # The sub-type of the query that failed
      user # The user who ran the query that failed
      startTime # The RCA start time
      mcon # The MCON of the table associated with the RCA
      layer
      upstreamMcon # The mcon of the upstream change rca table
    }
    ... on DbtRca {
      __typename
      rcaType # RCA type
      rcaUuid # Unique identifier of an RCA
      rcaSubtype # Type of issue connected to node
      jobErrorType # resolve from jobrun_root_error_type
      dbtRunUuid # UUID of the dbt run
      mcon # The MCON of the table associated with the RCA
      jobrunRootErrorType # The full root error type of the job
      failedNodes # List of failed nodes in the run
      modelErrorMsgBase64 # The error description for the failed node
      rcaMnTs # When the Airflow task started
      startTime # The RCA start time
    }
    ... on QdrDataRca {
      __typename
      rcaType # RCA type
      rcaUuid # Unique identifier of an RCA
      queryLogGroupHash # Hash of query group the query belongs to
      queryLogId # UUID of specific query
      queryType # The type of query that failed
      querySubtype # The sub-type of the query that failed
      user # The user who ran the query that failed
      startTime # The RCA start time
      mcon # The MCON of the table associated with the RCA
    }
    ... on AirflowRca {
      __typename
      rcaType # RCA type
      rcaUuid # Unique identifier of an RCA
      rcaSubtype # Type of issue connected to node
      dagId # Airflow id of the DAG
      taskId # Airflow id of the task
      runId # Airflow specific run id of failed task
      errorMsgBase64 # Failed error msg in base 64 encoding
      upstreamErrorMsgBase64 # Failed upstream error msg in base 64 encoding
      upstreamFailedTaskId # Relevant for failed failed upstream task status which caused the task to not run
      startTime # The RCA start time
      mcon # The MCON of the table associated with the RCA
    }
  }
}

graphql.query:
query getMonitors($monitorTypes: [UserDefinedMonitors], $statusTypes: [MonitorStatusType], $descriptionFieldOrTable: [String], $domainId: UUID, $uuids: [String], $createdByFilters: CreatedByFilters, $labels: [String], $search: [String], $searchFields: [UserDefinedMonitorSearchFields], $namespaces: [String], $isTemplateManaged: Boolean, $isOotbReplacement: Boolean, $mcons: [String], $orderBy: String, $limit: Int, $offset: Int) {
  getMonitors(
    monitorTypes: $monitorTypes
    statusTypes: $statusTypes
    descriptionFieldOrTable: $descriptionFieldOrTable
    domainId: $domainId
    uuids: $uuids
    createdByFilters: $createdByFilters
    labels: $labels
    search: $search
    searchFields: $searchFields
    namespaces: $namespaces
    isTemplateManaged: $isTemplateManaged
    isOotbReplacement: $isOotbReplacement
    mcons: $mcons
    orderBy: $orderBy
    limit: $limit
    offset: $offset
  ) {
    __typename
    uuid # Unique identifier for monitors
    monitorType # Type of monitor
    createdTime # Monitor creation time (UTC)
    lastUpdateTime # Monitor last update time (UTC)
    creatorId # Email of user who created the monitor
    updaterId # Email of user who last updated the monitor
    resourceId # Warehouse Unique Identifier
    entities # Full table IDs for monitored tables/views
    entityMcons # MCONs for monitored tables/views
    scheduleType # Monitor scheduling type
    name # Monitor/rule name, default or user-defined
    ruleName # DEPRECATED: Rule name, default or user-defined, null for monitors. Use name instead.
    description # Monitor user-defined name
    notes # Notes defined on this monitor
    labels # List of tags used to filter a monitor
    severity # Default severity for incidents involving this monitor
    # comparisons # Metric evaluator configuration
    # notificationSettings # Notification channels that match the monitor
    notifyRuleRunFailure # Whether audiences will be notified when the rule fails to execute
    isSnoozeable # Whether the monitor can be snoozed
    isPaused # Whether the monitor is currently paused
    isTemplateManaged # Whether the monitor was created from through monitor-as-code
    namespace # The monitor-as-code namespace used when creating the monitor
    nextExecutionTime # The next time (UTC) in which the monitor will run
    prevExecutionTime # The last time (UTC) in which the monitor ran
    isTransitioningDataProvider
    # scheduleConfig
    sevenDaysIncidentCount # Number of incidents in the past 7 days
    # incidentCountHistory # Number of incidents per day for the past 30 days
    weeklyIncidentCountChangeRate # Change in percentage between between last 7 days and the 7 days before.
    monitorFields # Field/s to monitor
    monitorTimeAxisFieldName # The name of the table/view field used for establishing the table time
    monitorTimeAxisFieldType # Type of time axis field used for establishing the table time
    whereCondition # Comparison predicate for the monitor SQL query
    usePartitionClause # Whether to use automatic partition filter in query
    segmentedExpressions # Fields or expressions used to segment the monitored field (currently supports one such value)
    historyDays # Number of lookback days for each monitor execution
    # selectExpressions # Monitor select expression
    selectedMetrics # Selected metrics for the monitor. If empty, all metrics will be monitored. Only available for Field Health monitors.
    aggTimeInterval # For field health and dimension monitoring, the aggregation time interval to use. Either HOUR or DAY
    hasCustomRuleName # Whether the monitor has a name given by the monitor creator
    ruleDescription # **DEPRECATED**
    # ruleComparisons # Deprecated in favor of comparisons
    ruleNotes # **DEPRECATED**
    ruleVariables # variables defined for the sql rule
    isSnoozed # Whether the monitor is currently snoozed
    snoozeUntilTime # If snoozed, the wake up time in UTC
    slackSnoozeUser # Slack user who snoozed rule
    conditionalSnooze # Whether the monitor is conditionally snoozed
    breachRate # Percentage of last 10 runs in which the monitor's condition was breached
    intervalMinutes # Interval between monitor runs, in minutes
    monitorRunStatus # Monitor run status
    monitorConfigurationStatus # Monitor configuration status
    monitorTrainingStatus # Monitor training status
    monitorStatus # Consolidated monitor status
    exceptions # Exceptions if any occurred during the last run
  }
}

query getMonitor($uuid: UUID, $resourceId: UUID, $fullTableId: String, $mcon: String, $monitorType: String) {
  getMonitor(
    uuid: $uuid
    resourceId: $resourceId
    fullTableId: $fullTableId
    mcon: $mcon
    monitorType: $monitorType
  ) {
    __typename
    id # The ID of the object.
    uuid
    accountUuid # Customer account id
    projects # Projects associated with the monitor
    datasets # Datasets associated with the monitor
    isDeleted
    description
    notes
    # labels
    isTemplateManaged # Is this monitor managed by a configuration template (monitors-as-code)?
    namespace # Namespace of rule, used for monitors-as-code
    severity # Default severity for incidents involving this monitor
    # comparisons
    type
    fields
    entities # Entities (e.g. tables) associated with monitor
    # createdBy # Who added the monitor
    timeAxisFieldName
    timeAxisFieldType
    unnestFields
    aggTimeInterval
    historyDays
    aggSelectExpression
    whereCondition
    usePartitionClause # Whether to use automatic partition filter in query
    # schedule
    createdTime # When the monitor was first created
    monitorName # Name of monitor, must be unique per account, used for rule identityresolution for monitors-as-code, just a random UUID by default
    isPaused # Is this monitor paused?
    notifyRuleRunFailure # Flag to indicate whether or not to send a notification if the rule fails to run
    disableLookBackBootstrap # Flag to indicates whether to disable the look back bootstrap for a monitor
    segmentedExpressions # Fields or expressions to segment by
    selectedMetrics # Selected metrics for the monitor. If empty, all metrics will be monitored. Only available for Field Health monitors.
    minSegmentSize # Minimum number of rows for a segment to be retrieved. Segments with less rows than this will be discarded.
    # lastUpdateUser # Who was the last user to update the monitor
    lastUpdateTime # When the monitor was last updated
    # table # Table related to monitor
    # selectExpressions
    mcon
    fullTableId
    monitorType
    # scheduleConfig
    # notificationSettings
  }
}
